name: Dammen
overview: Dammen, is very similar to Checkers in English. Checkers is a variant of the drafts game that is played on a board with 8x8 spaces (the small board) with twelve discs each and where black starts. It is mainly played in Anglo-Saxon countries. In Great Britain and Ireland it is called English draughts, in the United States and Canada the same game is called checkers. Dammen, typically has a 10x10 board, but the rules are typically the same.
